info.game_comments:
Bob Harris game 1.
Alex is dressed as the Statue of Liberty in honor of Halloween.

(1, 1).clue: He pioneered the novel with "Robinson Crusoe" & the ghost story with "The Apparition of One Mrs. Veal"

(2, 1).clue: Not one but two of this king's six wives are said to haunt Hampton Court Palace

(3, 1).clue: Cavities in the skull called orbits house these organs

(4, 1).clue: In 1997 this ex-Senate majority leader agreed to loan Newt Gingrich money for his ethics violation fine

(5, 1).clue: To ruin carefully laid plans is to do this

(6, 1).clue: (Good evening!)  Men who've played me on Broadway & screen are Frank Langella in the '70s & this man in the '20s & '30s

(1, 2).clue: He wrote the ghost tale "The Turn of the Screw", while his brother William studied spiritualism

(2, 2).clue: Glamis Castle in this U.K. country has several ghosts, including an earl who gambled with the devil, & lost

(3, 2).clue: This liquid makes up about 20% of a bone's weight, as opposed to about 60% of the weight of the entire body

(4, 2).clue: With his real-life show on home improvement, he proves you can go "Home Again"

(5, 2).clue: In song, Ida was as sweet as this

(6, 2).clue: Monthly occurrence that caused the transformation seen here:

(1, 3).clue: In the Wagnerian version, this ghost puts into port every 7 years to seek true love

(2, 3).clue: Screaming ghosts have been heard at the old Lalaurie House on Royal Street in this section of New Orleans

(3, 3).clue: Also called the kneecap, it's an example of a sesamoid bone because it's encased in tendons

(4, 3).clue: Eric Clapton's hit "I Shot The Sheriff" was actually written & recorded earlier by this reggae star

(5, 3).clue: Singularly, it's a brandy; in the plural, a Kellogg's cinnamon toasty cereal

(6, 3).clue: (Here's the Frankenstein Monster.)  In a 1935 film Elsa Lanchester played my bride & in the prologue, this author

(1, 4).clue: In his book "Without Feathers", a ghost reports that the next world resembles Cleveland

(2, 4).clue: This magician who died on Halloween is said to haunt the ruins of his Hollywood Hills estate

(3, 4).clue: Osteoblasts, osteocytes & osteoclasts are types of these basic units that make up bones

(5, 4).clue: If everything is just so or perfect, it's in this kind of order

(6, 4).clue: (Here's the Phantom.)  City in which I made my home

(1, 5).clue: The ghost in an Oscar Wilde tale doesn't haunt Canterbury but this home near Ascot

(2, 5).clue: A violent ghost called the Bell Witch allegedly murdered John Bell in this "Volunteer State" in 1820

(3, 5).clue: This long, flat bone is made up of 3 parts with the most ribs attached to the middle part

(5, 5).clue: This PBS science series tells viewers the gravity of the situation

(6, 5).clue: (The Creature.) Body of water in which I first saw Kay Lawrence, the love of my life

(1, 1).clue: Ethnic Uzbeks make up 9% of Turkmenistan, 24% of Tajikistan & 71% of this country

(2, 1).clue: "Take The 'A' Train" was Duke Ellington's theme & "One O'Clock Jump" was this "noble" bandleader's

(3, 1).clue: The last "Stars & Bars" flag of the Confederacy had this many stars; it must have been unlucky

(4, 1).clue: St. Mary's College, just north of South Bend, is about a mile from this larger Catholic school

(5, 1).clue: The story of this unfinished ziggurat was once used to explain the origin of languages

(6, 1).clue: Ice cream flavor seen here in an astronaut version:

(1, 2).clue: In 1942 this nation controlled all or part of a dozen present-day eastern Asian countries

(2, 2).clue: '90s jazzmen like Joshua Redman play '30s music in Robert Altman's film set in this Missouri city

(3, 2).clue: Gen. Buckner unconditionally surrendered Fort Donelson to this Union general

(4, 2).clue: Eureka College in Illinois is the alma mater of this U.S. president born not far off in Tampico

(5, 2).clue: After his death, his final lines in the film "Giant" were dubbed by Nick Adams

(1, 3).clue: As a large & geographically distinct part of Asia, India is often called one of these

(2, 3).clue: Sax great heard here in a 1960 recording:

(3, 3).clue: The announcement of the Union's victory at Vicksburg was made on this summer national holiday

(4, 3).clue: Coed schools in Ohio include Dyke, Malone & this first U.S. coeducational college

(5, 3).clue: Despite its popular name, Schubert may not have planned it to have more than 2 movements

(6, 3).clue: Derived from Greek, it's another term for pharmacist

(1, 4).clue: Cape Baba, jutting into this arm of the Mediterranean, is Asia's westernmost mainland point

(2, 4).clue: A slightly lowered unit of the scale, or a label that has recorded Thelonious Monk & Herbie Hancock

(3, 4).clue: The only person executed after the war for his war crimes was Henry Wirz, commander of this prison

(4, 4).clue: Beloit, in this state, is one of the USA's most respected small colleges

(5, 4).clue: The biggest mystery in "The Mystery of Edwin Drood" is how this author planned to finish it

(0, 0).clue: Mythical Halloween being in the title of the oft-repeated animated TV special that debuted October 27, 1966
